page.title: 04FARMING..EMPLOYMENT
page.content: From 1950-1970 the Stewart family farmed Pitbladdo as a dairy farm. However, in 1970, when the first of their two sons was ready to leave school and come into the family business, they decided to expand. They rented additional land and changed over to arable farming. They now own 850 acres and employ two farmworkers in addition to the two sons already working on the farm. The employees live rent free in new houses, built on the estate. The other tied cottages on the land have been modernised and either sold or rented. Mrs.Stewart now spends most of her time on paperwork associated with unning the farm. This has increased dramatically over the years, especially since the introduction of V.A.T. which, as agriculture is zero rated, farmers have to claim back.
